Dave:

I'm sure that the list of tests to run is just stored as text, and so the
system doesn't bother removing anything that it might not be able to load.
Likely, no-one ever considered that an important feature.

...and don't write like a wiseass, please. You actually asked a specific
question, which is all I've been asking for on this list. You showed
evidence of having thought about things. There would be no reason to "flame"
you for that.

If you had just removed "And before you flame me..." from your message, I
wouldn't think you were acting like a wiseass. I'm sure nobody would.

Give respect; get respect. Give none; get none.

JBR.

----- Begin original message -----
Why does the junit.samples.SimpleTest appear in my list of tests to run,
even though I've deleted the class files from my classpath?  When I
click the "..." button, it does not show up, but it does in the drop
down list.

Any ideas?

(And before you flame me, I did search the archives and faq, and have
dome some problem solving on my own!)

-dave-
